body.p: The Board considered and rejected a proposal to permit all entities participating in multi‑employer defined benefit plans to account for those plans as defined contribution plans. The Board concluded that extending that exemption would be contrary to its general approach of limiting exceptions. In the Board’s view such an exemption would not be appropriate for all multi‑employer plans, such as when an entity becomes a dominant participant in a multi‑employer plan, perhaps because other participants leave the plan.
